properties.headline: Bathurst 1000 - Thursday 15 to Sunday 18 October - BATHURST Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy approaching Mount Panorama
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 4,000 people each day are expected to attend the annual Bathurst 1000 motor racing event from Thursday to Sunday at Mount Panorama. Gates open from 8.30am Thursday and 8am Friday to Sunday. Racing finishes between 5pm and 6pm each day.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads between Sydney and Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Highway and Bells Line of Rd, and along the Mitchell Hwy from Orange, the Mid-Western Hwy from Cowra and the Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Local roads in Bathurst are also expected to be busy. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time in the area during the event.

arrangementElements.html:
BATHURST 

6AM MONDAY 12 OCTOBER UNTIL 2PM MONDAY 19 OCTOBER

  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-racing Circuit will be limited to residents and accredited vehicles 
  • Ray Bant Drive will be under managed access
  • Access to the National Motor-Racing Museum (Ray Bant Drive) will be facilitated between Monday 12 October through to Wednesday 14 October (event week), the venue will be closed to the public on event days
  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-Racing circuit via Hinton Road will closed

THURSDAY 15 OCTOBER UNTIL SUNDAY 18 OCTOBER

  • Access to Ray Bant Drive will be limited to Residents, Rydges guests/workers and accredited workers/vehicles
arrangementElements.title: Changed access arrangements

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy

properties.headline: NRL - Saturday 10 October - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Semi Final: Eels v Rabbitohs at Bankwest Stadium from 7:50pm until 9:50pm approx. Preliminary games from 12:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as thousands of fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium will close prior to full-time for around an hour and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct. The following closures will be in place:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

properties.headline: Randwick Race Day - Saturday 10 October - RANDWICK Anzac Pde, Alison Rd, High St approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Randwick Race Day Special event clearways
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Randwick Race Course Spring Carnival 19 September.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Randwick Race Day Special event clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
The Everest Carnival - Spring Champion Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse from 1:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier on roads around the racecourse including Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on sections of Ascot St from 8am to 7pm and High St from 3pm to 7pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

RANDWICK 

FROM 8AM TO 7PM

  • Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and the roundabout at the racecourse (both sides)

FROM 3PM TO 7PM

  • High St between the gate 2 entry to UNSW and Anzac Pde (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Pde, Alison Rd, High St

webLinks.linkText: Hockey Dad - Alive at the Drive-In

properties.headline: Drive-in concerts - Friday 9 and Saturday 10 October - BULLI Princes Hwy at Grevillea Park Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Drive-in concerts will be held at Bulli Showgrounds on Friday and Saturday with a capacity for 400 vehicles.

Hockey Dad Alive at the Drive-in ft The Pinheads from 6pm to 9:30pm approx on Friday and Saturday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic may be heavier than usual on the Princes Hwy approaching Grevillea Park Rd as attendees enter and exit Bulli Showgrounds.
properties.displayName: Drive-in concerts - Friday 9 and Saturday 10 October

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 9 October - MOORE PARK Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Lang Rd, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park walking & transport route map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park walking & transport route map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Semi Final: Roosters v Raiders at The SCG from 7:50pm until 9:50pm approx.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the game during Friday evening peak.

Driver Ave is now partially closed and will reopen after full-time once crowds have safely cleared the precinct. 

Special event clearways are in effect on various roads between Central and Moore Park until 11pm including sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 6AM TO 11PM

  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street

FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways
